page.title: 08DERBY RAMATHON
page.content: The{Derby Ramathon}is a marathon road race that takes place each year. It is named after the nickname of Derby County, the Rams. The race is 26.2 miles although many runners settle for the half marathon. It is essentially a fun run and although many trained athletes take part, most competitors {run for fun}being sponsored by their friends for charity. Crowds line the streets and cheer all the runners regardless of their position in the race. This is something fairly new to Britain, a phenomenon of the eighties imported from America and now held in most cities and towns in this country. The amazing thing about the runners is the wide spread of ages from teenagers to men and women in their seventies. The marathon syndrome has coincided with a national awareness of the importance of{physical fitness.}
